items.content_html:
I had always thought it was impossible to figure out the keyboard layout of devices so I was glad to finally learn about this api.
I wish I knew about it sooner though so I think this a nice place to mention it.

Keep in mind that the api mentioned is still a draft and currently only supported in Chrome.
items.title: Mention and link to Keyboard Map api in KeyboardEvent.code

items.content_html:
According to JavaScript's lexical grammar at
https://262.ecma-international.org/12.0/#sec-literals-numeric-literals,
numeric literals are unsigned. This commit removes examples and
content which incorrectly imply that numeric literals can be preceeded
by a sign.

It also fixes an unrelated minor pre-existing "flaw" signalled by the
MDN preview tool on the same page.

What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)
This fix is needed because the content is technically incorrect.

Issue number (if there is an associated issue)

Anything else that could help us review it
items.title: Fix content implying JS numeric literals can be signed

items.content_html:
This is part of #6108.

We are dealing with features that are no more on the standard track (deprecated), with bcd tables. The idea is to remove the {{Specifications}}, that implies missing data in this case, without putting back an outdated table like before

Dealing with HTMLMenuItemElement:

  • I adapted the spec message
  • I removed the {{InterfaceOverview}} macro that is broken (do not add any overview, just empty sections) and breaks the Hx structure of the page (we need to remove this macro from MDN Web Docs).
items.title: Modify spec message of  HTMLMenuItemElememt

items.content_html:
This is part of #6108.

We are dealing with features that are no more on the standard track (deprecated), with bcd tables. The idea is to remove the {{Specifications}}, that implies missing data in this case, without putting back an outdated table like before

Dealing with Document.createTouch, Document.createTouchList and DoucumentTouch:

  • I deleted DocumentTouch: it was a mixin, and is no longer in use!
  • I kept Document.createTouch, Document.createTouchList as they are stil in Firefox webidl. I think they are still in use in Firefox for Androis (and Safari for iOS). I updated the spec msg on them.

I hope we will soon be able to completely delete them.
items.title: Clean DocumentTouch, Document.createTouch(List)

items.content_html:
This is part of #6108.

We are dealing with features that are no more on the standard track (deprecated), with bcd tables. The idea is to remove the {{Specifications}}, that implies missing data in this case, without putting back an outdated table like before

Dealing with HTMLMediaElement.controller and HTMLMediaElement.mediaGroup.

If Safari wasn't still supporting it, I would have deleted them.

  • I removed the {{Specifications}} macro and replaced it with a text.
  • I added the deprecated banner at the top
  • Removed the red link to MediaController never documented (and we won't document it at this point)
items.title: Fix spec msg for MediaController-related properties

items.content_html:
Hey ðŸ‘‹

I know the microtask guide is still a draft, but I went ahead and fixed some grammar/typos that I noticed when reading through it.
items.title: fix typos/grammar in microtask guide

items.content_html:
This is part of #5865, and removes all consecutive <dd> elements in the CSS docs.

Although of course we're allowed to have consecutive <dd> elements in HTML, given the way we use <dl> in MDN, in practice we (almost?) never need them. So to keep things simpler, the Markdown extension we're using for <dl> will not support consecutive <dd> or <dt> elements.

There are some places where we do have consecutive <dd> elements, but I don't think any of the ones I've seen so far (in all the JS and CSS docs) are semantically valid. I'm guessing that a lot of the places we have them are because with the WYSIWYG editor in the old Wiki it was easy to add new <dd> elements by mistake, rather than including multiple paragraphs in a single <dd>.

In #4625 I removed them in the JS docs, and this does the same for the CSS docs.
items.title: Fix consecutive dd elements in CSS

items.content_html:
Now, if you first run:

yarn start

in one terminal, and

yarn build

in another. Now both the yarn build and the yarn start will share the same overwritten BUILD_OUT_ROOT environment variable.
items.title: make 'yarn start' be aware of BUILD_OUT_ROOT

items.content_html:
To go alongside #6335 this is the attachInternals() method for Element.

Reviewer: @jpmedley
items.title: adds the Element.attachInternals() method

items.content_html:
Adds the ElementInternals API, including the de-mixined AriaMixin.

Reviewer: @jpmedley

Joe, it might help to understand the process I followed to pull in the AriaMixin stuff, as you probably don't need to go through each one in detail.

I copied in the pages that we worked on previously, I updated them for the new guidelines, and made sure the syntax and example was relevant for when used with ElementInternals. However the bulk of the description is verbatim from the original set, as it doesn't change when used with ElementInternals. So, most of this has already been reviewed essentially other than the front matter, syntax and example section.

This has been quite a complex one to work through and test code, but hopefully isn't too wide of the mark. I need to go make a PR to adds specs, and a couple of missing things to BCD. I also need to add Element.attachInternals() but I'll do that in a separate PR as this one is a bit epic already.

Fixes: #1705
items.title: Adds ElementInternals

items.content_html:
This is part of #1146.

I sourced specification for HTML attributes using {{Specification}}

A few notes:

  • I'm not sure having HTML/attributes/ pages (and SVG/attributes) is a good thing. I'm not judging this here, I merely addapt them.
  • BCD for input attribute is next to non-existent. I'm not fixing this here.
  • I used several macros for the cases where the attributes are on several elements.
  • Missing spec_url where bcd was present are fixed in mdn/browser-compat-data#11240
  • If no bcd, I keep the error message: it will be fixed when we add bcd info.

After this PR, there are 0 {{SpecName}}/{{Spec2}} macros left in web/html.

I plan to use the same techniques for the SVG attributes (>200 tables!)
items.title: Source spec info from macros for HTML attributes

items.content_html:
What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)
If a web server can detect a loop, it'll send the 500 error; it can't send the server error if it cannot detect the loop.

Issue number (if there is an associated issue)
n/a

Anything else that could help us review it
n/a
items.title: correct typo: "if the server _can_ detect [a loop], it will send back a 500"

items.content_html: I really like the way the meta-docs for BCD refer to the place decisions were made, so this PR does the same for Markdown choices. I'm open to suggestions for better wording choices than "discussion reference" and "this issue was resolved" but I think it'll do in the absence of anything better.
items.title: Add references to Markdown guide
